title: Flea
description: Robert Hooke's detailed microscopic observation of a flea from his seminal work Micrographia (1665). Hooke describes the creature's remarkable physical structure, noting 'the strength and beauty of this small creature' and documenting its articulated legs, protective armor-like exoskeleton, sensory organs, and feeding apparatus with precision that remains impressive by modern standards.
primarySource: Robert Hooke, Micrographia: or, Some physiological descriptions of minute bodies made by magnifying glasses (London: J. Martyn and J. Allestry, 1665), pp. 210-11. (Observation 53)
